oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NONLINEAR WAVE TRANSFORMATION DUE TO A SUBMERGED BREAKWATER
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Isobe, Masahiko
Watanabe, Akira
Yamamoto, Shogo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: nonlinear wave
wave transformation
breakwater
submerged breakwater
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A nonlinear model of wave transformation due to a submerged breakwater is developed on the basis of the nonlinear mild-slope equations. Numerical computation shows that significant amount of wave energy can be transferred from the fundamental component to higher harmonics by adjusting configuration of the submerged breakwater. In case of oblique incidence, wave direction as well as wave period changes due to the breakwater. These results implies the possibility to control wave period and direction as well as wave height.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
